trans-unit.source: Represents an ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) color.
Named colors are represented by using the properties of the Color structure.
For more information about these colors, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB).
Each of the four components is a number from 0 through 255, with 0 representing no intensity and 255 representing full intensity.
The alpha component specifies the transparency of the color: 0 is fully transparent, and 255 is fully opaque.

To determine the alpha, red, green, or blue component of a color, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.G%2A>, or <xref:System.Drawing.Color.B%2A> property, respectively.
You can create a custom color by using one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb%2A> methods.
Gets the alpha component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB).
The alpha component specifies the transparency of the color: 0 is fully transparent, and 255 is fully opaque.
Likewise, an A value of 255 represents an opaque color.
An A value from 1 through 254 represents a semitransparent color.
The color becomes more opaque as A approaches 255.
The alpha component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFF0F8FF`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFAEBD7`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FF00FFFF`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets the blue component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB).
Each of the four components is a number from 0 through 255, with 0 representing no intensity and 255 representing full intensity.
Likewise, B is a value from 0 to 255 with 0 representing no blue and 255 representing fully blue.
The blue component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.

Represents a color that is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Tests whether the specified object is a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure and is equivalent to this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
This structure only does comparisons with other <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structures.
To compare colors based solely on their ARGB values, you should use the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.ToArgb%2A> method.
This is because the Equals and <xref:System.Drawing.Color.op_Equality%2A> members determine equivalency using more than just the ARGB value of the colors.
For example, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Black%2A> and `FromArgb(0,0,0)` are not considered equal, since <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Black%2A> is a named color and `FromArgb(0,0,0)` is not.
The object to test.
if obj is a structure equivalent to this structure; otherwise, .
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFB22222`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFFFAF0`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FF228B22`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.
The byte-ordering of the 32-bit ARGB value is AARRGGBB.
The most significant byte (MSB), represented by AA, is the alpha component value.
The second, third, and fourth bytes, represented by RR, GG, and BB, respectively, are the color components red, green, and blue, respectively.
A value specifying the 32-bit ARGB value.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure that this method creates.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure from the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure, but with the new specified alpha value.
Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for the alpha value, the value is limited to 8 bits.
To create an opaque color, set `alpha` to 255.
To create a semitransparent color, set `alpha` to any value from 1 through 254.
The alpha value for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> from which to create the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that this method creates.
alpha is less than 0 or greater than 255.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue).
The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).
Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for each color component, the value of each component is limited to 8 bits.
The red component value for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The green component value for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The blue component value for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that this method creates.
red, green, or blue is less than 0 or greater than 255.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values.
Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for each component, the value of each component is limited to 8 bits.
To create an opaque color, set `alpha` to 255.
To create a semitransparent color, set `alpha` to any value from 1 through 254.
The alpha component.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The red component.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The green component.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The blue component.
Valid values are 0 through 255.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that this method creates.
alpha, red, green, or blue is less than 0 or greater than 255.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure from the specified predefined color.
A predefined color is also called a known color and is represented by an element of the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.
An element of the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> enumeration.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that this method creates.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure from the specified name of a predefined color.
A predefined color is also called a known color and is represented by an element of the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.

If the `name` parameter is not the valid name of a predefined color, the FromName method creates a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that has an ARGB value of 0 (that is, all ARGB components are 0).
A string that is the name of a predefined color.
Valid names are the same as the names of the elements of the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> enumeration.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that this method creates.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFF00FF`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets the green component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB).
Each of the four components is a number from 0 through 255, with 0 representing no intensity and 255 representing full intensity.
Likewise, G is a value from 0 to 255 with 0 representing no green and 255 representing fully green.
The green component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFDCDCDC`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) brightness value for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The brightness of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The brightness ranges from 0.0 through 1.0, where 0.0 represents black and 1.0 represents white.
Returns a hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
An integer value that specifies the hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) hue value, in degrees, for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The hue, in degrees, of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The hue is measured in degrees, ranging from 0.0 through 360.0, in HSB color space.
Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) saturation value for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The saturation of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The saturation ranges from 0.0 through 1.0, where 0.0 is grayscale and 1.0 is the most saturated.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFF8F8FF`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFFD700`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFDAA520`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FF808080`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> strcture representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FF008000`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFADFF2F`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFF0FFF0`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFF69B4`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFCD5C5C`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FF4B0082`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Specifies whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure is uninitialized.
This property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this color is uninitialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure is a predefined color.
Predefined colors are represented by the elements of the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> enumeration.
This property does not do a comparison of the ARGB values.

Therefore, when the IsKnownColor property is applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that is created by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb%2A> method, IsKnownColor returns `false`, even if the ARGB value matches the ARGB value of a predefined color.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> was created from a predefined color by using either the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromName*> method or the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromKnownColor*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure is a named color or a member of the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> enumeration.
This property does not do a comparison of the ARGB values.

Therefore, when the IsNamedColor property is applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that is created by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb%2A> method, IsNamedColor returns `false`, even if the ARGB value matches the ARGB value of a predefined color.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> was created by using either the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromName*> method or the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromKnownColor*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure is a system color.
A system color is a color that is used in a Windows display element.
System colors are represented by elements of the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> enumeration.
This property does not do a comparison of the ARGB values.

Therefore, when the IsSystemColor property is applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that is created by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb%2A> method, IsSystemColor returns `false`, even if the ARGB value matches the ARGB value of a system color.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> was created from a system color by using either the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromName*> method or the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromKnownColor*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFFFFF0`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFF0E68C`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFE6E6FA`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFFF0F5`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).

Gets the name of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.

For custom colors, the RGB value is returned.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Tests whether two specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structures are equivalent.
This method compares more than the ARGB values of the <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structures.
It also does a comparison of some state flags.
If you want to compare just the ARGB values of two <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structures, compare them using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.ToArgb%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that is to the left of the equality operator.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that is to the right of the equality operator.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the two <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structures are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Tests whether two specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structures are different.
This method compares more than the ARGB values of the <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structures.
It also does a comparison of some state flags.
If you want to compare just the ARGB values of two <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structures, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.ToArgb%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that is to the left of the inequality operator.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that is to the right of the inequality operator.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the two <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structures are different; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets the red component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB).
Each of the four components is a number from 0 through 255, with 0 representing no intensity and 255 representing full intensity.
Likewise, R is a value from 0 to 255 with 0 representing no red and 255 representing fully red.
The red component value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Gets the 32-bit ARGB value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
The byte-ordering of the 32-bit ARGB value is AARRGGBB.
The most significant byte (MSB), represented by AA, is the alpha component value.
The second, third, and fourth bytes, represented by RR, GG, and BB, respectively, are the color components red, green, and blue, respectively
The 32-bit ARGB value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> value of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure.
A predefined color is also called a known color and is represented by an element of the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.

When the ToKnownColor method is applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that is created by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb%2A> method, ToKnownColor returns 0, even if the ARGB value matches the ARGB value of a predefined color.

ToKnownColor also returns 0 when it is applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that is created by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromName%2A> method with a string name that is not valid.

An element of the <xref href="System.Drawing.KnownColor"></xref> enumeration, if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> is created from a predefined color by using either the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromName*> method or the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromKnownColor*> method; otherwise, 0.
Gets a system-defined color that has an ARGB value of `#FFFF6347`.
For an example of this color, see [Colors by Name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=92332).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing a system-defined color.
Converts this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure to a human-readable string.
A predefined color is also called a known color and is represented by an element of the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.

When the ToString method is applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure that is created by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb%2A> method, ToString returns a string that consists of the ARGB component names and their values, even if the ARGB value matches the ARGB value of a predefined color.

A string that is the name of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>, if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> is created from a predefined color by using either the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromName*> method or the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.FromKnownColor*> method; otherwise, a string that consists of the ARGB component names and their values.
